intro: Alatococcus, commonly known as the dwarf alpine buttercup, is a small flowering plant native to high-altitude regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae, which includes many showy and often toxic plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine soils, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are simple and alternate, and it produces yellow flowers with five petals. Alatococcus is known for its resilience to harsh climates and is often found in mountainous areas.
